post_text: Student members of the THS LEO Club, and Boy Scout Troop 75, the local troop, worked together for the 3rd year on a combined Annual Pasta Supper held at the Lyceum in Terryville. Once again students in the Foods Classes and Professional/Vocational Levels prepared the meatballs and sauce from scratch and manned the kitchen side of the event. In the end, more than 75 local and area youth worked together to hold a great event that raised money to support youth and charity programs while giving student experience in foodservice work and community collaboration. Local support from businesses and groups help offset the cost of the larger rented facility and made possible the great raffles, and live entertainment.

post_text: Students from the Terryville High School Foods Classes attended the state competition sponsored by the CT Restaurant Association. Accompanied by the Career and Technical Education Teacher for Hospitality and Tourism, Mrs. DeCarolis, students took in the process that they will be competing under in 2020/2021 School Year. There are two primary competitions are in the area of food preparation skills and restaurant management and creation. The pictures are of the students who attended in order to become familiar with what the competition will be like next year. There are also pictures of some of the food prepared by students from around the state and some of their restaurant and food truck concepts. Students came away with a lot of ideas and a plan to learn, train, and prepare for next year.

post_text: Shakespeare came alive today at the high school. The English Department held in house workshops where actors from the local Shakespearience company made the poetic, flowery text more accessible to students. It was a celebration of the spoken language and empowered students with confidence and public speaking skills. (Shakespearience.org)

post_text: Terryville High School students returned from their Close-Up Washington DC trip on Saturday. In the final days of the trip, students traveled to Colonial Williamsburg, visited Arlington National Cemetery, went to the National Archives to see the original Declaration of Independence, the Constitution and Bill of Rights, and toured the Newseum. At the Newseum, students saw the largest unaltered piece of the Berlin Wall outside of Germany, as well as a portion of the World Trade Center's North Tower antenna. This was a special week for our students; they debated contemporary issues, learned about the history of Washington D.C., and met members of Congress who represent them.

THS Cross Country course record SMASHED!
THS senior Chris Deforest set out to beat the THS XC course record of 17:03, set by a Northwestern runner in 2015. Chris attacked the demanding course of hills and trails, setting a new course record of 16:40.

The Boy's Cross Country team defeated both Northwestern and Wamogo, with 5 runners finishing under 19:14.

The Girl's Cross Country squad was led by sophomore Katie Deforest, finishing nearly a minute and a half ahead of her competition.

The THS campus was busy yesterday afternoon, as Varsity Boy's Soccer also competed at home in a heated battle against Northwestern. While coming up short, the team is growing and improving each time out on the field.

post_text: The THS DRAMA Club's fall show has open leading roles for students grades 3-8 and 9-12. The show Frenzied Fairy Tales is auditioning Elementary School Students, Middle School, and High School Students in the Plymouth Public Schools this Sunday 9/15/19 from 1pm to 3pm and then doing a show reading through 3-5pmm along with another round of auditions Monday 9/16/2019 from 3pm to 5pm. All students who audition and want to be in the show will be found a spot or role in the production, beyond the 8 specific roles for kids in that age range. Any parent or guardian with questions can contact the THS DRAMA Club Advisor and Director/Co-Producer Chris Perkins at perkinsc@plymouth.k12.ct.us Terryville High School students can audition Friday 9/13/19 2:30-3:30pm, Sunday 9/15/19 1 to 3pm and by appointment with Mr. Perkins. All students who want a part or role in the show will get one, all are welcome and invited to join the show in front of the curtain or behind. (pics from past years)
